io::​stream
interface
io::​ .​stream
io::​ .​file

Provides a higher level interface to an I/O stream device.

Closing and flushing
close
pure virtual function void close()

Flush and close the stream.

If the stream is already closed, this method silently returns.

Once a stream is closed, any read/write operation on the stream is will result in a fatal error.

flush
pure virtual function void flush()

Flush the write buffers of the stream if such exist.

This method does nothing for read-only streams.

closed
pure virtual function bit closed()

Returns 1 if the stream is closed, or 0 otherwise.

Positioning
position

Returns the current stream position.

seek
pure virtual function void seek(
int 
_offset,
io::
whence_enum 
_whence
= 
io::SEEK_SET
)

seek to a new position in stream.

offset specifies the number of bytes to seek from a given position.

whence is an optional argument that defaults to whence_enum::SEEK_SET and may be set to any one of the 3 values:

SEEK_SET

offset is added tothe start position of stream, and should be a positive int.

SEEK_CUR

offset is added to the current stream position, and can be positive (to seek forward) or negative (to seek backwards).

SEEK_END

offset is added to the last stream position and is usually negative, although some platfroms allow seeking beyond the end of a stream.

rewind
pure virtual function void rewind()

Rewinds the current position to the start of the stream.

Inquiries
seekable
pure virtual function bit seekable()

Returns 1 if the stream supports random access, or 0 otherwise.

readable
pure virtual function bit readable()

Returns 1 if the stream was opened for reading, or 0 otherwise.

writeable
pure virtual function bit writeable()

Returns 1 if the stream was opened for writing, or 0 otherwise.

Reading
read
pure virtual function string read(
int 
_size
 = 
0
)

Read at most _size bytes.

If _size is left unspecified, the entire stream data is read.

Data is returned as <string>.

readline
pure virtual function string readline(
int 
_size
 = 
0
)

Read and return one line from the stream.

if size is specified, at most size bytes will be read.

readinto
pure virtual function int readinto(
ref 
string 
_b,
input 
int 
_size
 = 
0
)

Read at most _size bytes of data from the stream into _b.

If _size is left unspecified, the entire stream data is read.

Returns the total number of bytes read from the stream.

readall
pure virtual function string readall()

Read all data from the stream, returned as <string>.

Writing
write
pure virtual function void write(
string 
_str
)

Write _str to stream.

writeln
pure virtual function void writeln(
string 
_str
)

Same as write but appends a newline at the end of the string.

Low-level API
mode
pure virtual function string mode()

Returns the string of the mode for which the stream was opened.

fileno
pure virtual function int fileno()

Returns the underlying file descriptor of the stream, if it exists.

If the object does not use a file descriptor, 0 is returned.
